parameters: \pop[2]Looks like it was time for me to chat with Dante.
\pop[2]Out of all the others, he was probably the closest to Isaac.
\pop[2]Because of that, current events were probably hitting him the hardest.
\pop[2]But with a strong bond, comes strong trust.
\pop[2]Against better judgment, it seems like he'd do anything for Isaac.
\pop[2]Even follow him into the heart of \c[10]Argus\c[0] HQ in the name of a better future.
\pop[2]The sarcasm in his voice is immense.
\pop[3]I wish we could be out there, helping the \c[23]zeros\c[0].
But I guess we're doing it in our own way.
\pop[3]It's the waiting that kills me, though.
There's so many people just... standing around.
Too little too late, some would say.
\pop[2]There's no denying it. What happened was truly awful.
\pop[2]There was \c[14]no\c[0] reason for those \c[23]zeros\c[0] to die. Not a single one.
\pop[2]I could see the guilt on the faces of people helping out in the town square.
\pop[2]"If only I stepped in sooner", is probably what they're thinking.
\pop[2]"If I help now, I'll feel less guilty about it", is the aura I feel in the air.
\pop[2]It's almost like they care more about their conscience than those lives.
\pop[2]But at the end of the day, help is still help, right?
\pop[2]Does it even matter what's going on through their heads?
\pop[2]Or am I just projecting what I feel onto the unsuspecting masses?
\pop[3]Better late than never, others would say.
At least now, there will only be \c[14]two\c[0] casualties.
\pop[2]Two too many, if you ask me.
\pop[3]How do you feel about all this, Delta?
I can tell it's affecting you more than you let on.
\i[5]"I trust Isaac. I know our role is greater than just feeding the \c[23]zeros\c[0]."
\i[2]"It was. But I feel calm, now that you're by my side."
\i[0]"I'm terrified. But my only choice is to follow Isaac."
\i[6]"Nope. This is \c[14]just\c[0] the life I was hoping for after moving."
\i[4]"\c[10]Argus\c[0] needs to fall. My resolve trumps anything else I feel."
\i[5]"I trust Isaac. I know our role is greater than just feeding the \c[23]zeros\c[0]."
\pop[3]But I think his entire life has led up to this Sunday.
I can't expect my best friend to handle this on his own.
\pop[3]It just makes me curious about his vision, though.
We win, but then we're no longer friends in the future?
You'd think something like this would bond us for life.
\pop[2]We made our pact to compete with his vision.
\pop[2]It's just an act of defying \c[17]Komorebi\c[0], like a lot of people do.
\pop[3]I guess so. Things are just getting \c[14]weird\c[0] lately.
Especially with that whole "being watched from the future" thing.
\i[2]"It was. But I feel calm, now that you're by my side."
\pop[3]Wow, really? Good to know I have that effect.
Personally, I won't be able to relax until Sunday is over.
\pop[3]But with everything going on, I hope you don't blame me.
In this situation, I don't think \c[14]anything\c[0] could calm me down.
\pop[2]He could try using a bit of denial, like everybody else.
\pop[3]Nah, I feel like facing my feelings head on.
Or at the very least, letting them out in my writing.
\pop[3]Speaking of writing, by the way, it's going well.
I lost a bit of time, but I think everything will be good.
After this blows over, I'll be \c[14]full\c[0] of inspiration.
\pop[3]Especially with how \c[14]weird\c[0] things have been lately.
I  mean, that whole "being watched from the future" thing?
\i[0]"I'm terrified. But my only choice is to follow Isaac."
\pop[3]Yeah. That's what it comes down to...
Trust in him, and trust in his vision, I guess.
\pop[3]A pretty risky move, but he has yet to let me down.
I don't think he'd drop the ball so close to the finish line.
\pop[3]Whatever he's planning to do in their HQ?
I'm sure it'll strike a blow to \c[10]Argus\c[0], and end all of this.
Those social theorists had a pretty good take on it, right?
\pop[3]A world of equality and progress is a pretty good outcome.
Far better than now, especially with how \c[14]weird\c[0] everything is.
I mean, that whole "being watched from the future" thing?
\i[6]"Nope. This is \c[14]just\c[0] the life I was hoping for after moving."
You're starting to sound like \c[14]me\c[0], Delta.
\pop[3]Not that there's anything wrong with that.
You know what they say about imitation.
\pop[2]He smiles, and rubs the back of his head.
\pop[3]I'm sorry your move had to go this way, though.
I mean, three simple weeks, and we're raiding \c[10]Argus\c[0] HQ?
Since you got here, almost \c[14]nothing\c[0] has been the same.
\pop[3]It's all just felt so... weird, lately.
Especially with that new theory of yours.
"Being watched from the future", or whatever?
\i[4]"\c[10]Argus\c[0] needs to fall. My resolve trumps anything else I feel."
We can turn our pain into something useful.
Gotta say, striking a blow to \c[10]Argus\c[0] will be pretty cathartic.
\pop[3]And if it works? I think they might call us heroes.
Everyone in the town square supports \c[23]Cipher\c[0], after all.
\c[23]Zero\c[0], or not? It doesn't even matter anymore.
\pop[3]December was a pretty wild month, all things considered.
And the weirdness sure doesn't seem like it's gonna slow down.
\pop[3]Especially with that new \c[14]theory\c[0] you've been throwing around.
"Being watched from the future", or something like that?
But so is the idea of \c[17]Komorebi\c[0], and here we are.
\pop[3]Time is just a bunch of nonsense anyway, isn't it?
The only thing that matters is the \c[14]moment\c[0].
\pop[3]At the end of the day, that's all we can really call our own...
\pop[3]Other people being able to see my memories?
You gotta be kidding me. That's \c[14]so\c[0] embarrassing.
\pop[3]After Sunday, I might \c[14]never\c[0] do anything again.
Just sit at home, and avoid creating any regrets.
\i[3]"I think that's what \c[10]Argus\c[0] is aiming for."
\i[3]"I think that's what \c[10]Argus\c[0] is aiming for."
\pop[3]I never figured they'd end up being \c[14]that\c[0] evil.
But I saw those bodies. I saw their true nature.
\pop[3]Also, I might as well get this out of the way.
Sorry, Delta, but I don't believe you.
\pop[2]I kinda figured I could convince all my friends.
\pop[2]Leave it to Dante to be the odd one out.
\pop[3]I don't think we're being watched right now.
\pop[3]But at the same time, they \c[14]did\c[0] announce this technology.
So maybe I'll meet you halfway, at the more believable part.
\pop[3]That one day, we'll be able to revisit these memories.
Remember what Taylor said \c[14]way\c[0] back when we were pregaming?
\pop[3]"Create some memories that we can revisit whenever we want."
I don't know about you, but that's been my motto lately.
\pop[2]Kind of an ironic thing for Taylor to say, given the circumstances.
\pop[3]I'd especially like to revisit my life \c[14]before\c[0] \c[10]The Midnight Deaths\c[0].
Heh. You know, the good old days?
\pop[3]As worried as I was, at least nothing \c[14]bad\c[0] happened to me.
So that's kinda the logic I'm using right now.
Seems to be a pretty comforting thought.
\pop[3]Gotta give you and Isaac some credit, though.
You have some pretty active imaginations.
\pop[3]Coming from a writer, that's a compliment, by the way.
I mean, sending memories to the future for \c[14]subterfuge\c[0]?
Engaging in the highest possible levels of corporate espionage?
\pop[3]You're giving me a bunch of ideas for my next book!
But I think that's all it is. A bunch of fiction spawned from fear.
\pop[3]Or maybe not fear. Maybe resolve is the right word...
You want to give our mission on Sunday more importance.
A greater cause is always easier to commit to, after all.
\pop[3]First it was the agent, now it's this.
\i[3]"I saw them at the party, too."
\i[3]"I saw them at the party, too."
\i[3]"I think they snuck in the back door, after Isaac "silenced" it."
\i[3]"I think they snuck in the back door, after Isaac "silenced" it."
\pop[3]Maybe we should just focus on the stuff we \c[14]can\c[0] confirm?
And yes, this is me, totally projecting my fright.
\pop[3]I don't know how I'd handle all the extra stress you seem to be embracing.
But I'm sure everything will be fine after all of this blows over.
\pop[3]We can talk about it on our date, actually.
I imagine that's gonna have to wait until after Sunday.
\pop[3]I'd suggest that we go to dinner \c[14]now\c[0], but...
If our friends tag along out of necessity, it's not really a date.
\pop[2]I nod. That seems fair to me.
\pop[2]Part of me is a little upset, but I can't exactly blame Dante.
\pop[2]Guess I just got lucky with convincing my other friends.
\pop[2]Or maybe it had to do with the lives they lived.
\pop[2]An idol, a streamer, a master of tech...
\pop[2]They all fueled their belief through experiences they've had.
\pop[2]I didn't just ask them to believe me, though. They almost convinced \c[14]themselves\c[0].
\pop[2]I'm tempted to try and convince him, but I decide to drop it for now.
\pop[2]As long as we have him by our side on Sunday, that's all that really matters.
\pop[2]I wonder if he'd change his mind if he knew that Isaac was \c[23]Hermes\c[0].
\pop[3]Speaking of extra stress, I kind of have a plan.
When we're in \c[10]Argus\c[0] HQ, I might sneak off on my own.
\pop[3]Hopefully not too far. Or ideally, not at all.
But if I can find a computer with high-level access there?
I \c[14]need\c[0] to look up my family. Right now, I have no clue where to start.
\pop[3]They don't live at my childhood home anymore, I looked into it.
And the people who live there now won't respond to my emails.
At an \c[10]Argus\c[0] computer, though, I can literally just search their names.
\pop[3]Then after everything is over, I can reconnect with my family.
If everyone else gets a new start, I think \c[14]I\c[0] want one, too.
So just be prepared, okay? I've already run it by Isaac.
\pop[3]But it's our secret for now, okay?
We're the only people that know.
\pop[2]He nudges me on the shoulder playfully.
\pop[3]Kinda like this little "future observation" thing, huh?
If it turns out to be true, I'll make sure to eat my words.
And I'll let you watch, so you can relive it over and over.
\pop[2]We both laugh, embracing the absurdity of what he's saying.
\pop[2]Perhaps belief wasn't as important as the willingness to follow.
\pop[2]The same could be said about the city folk in the town square, too.
\pop[2]They were \c[14]helping\c[0]. It was the action that mattered, not the reason.
\pop[2]Whether to clear a guilty conscience, or any number of things in-between...
\pop[2]We all wantaed the same thing. To show \c[10]Argus\c[0] that their reign was over.
\pop[2]Whatever came next? It was in the hands of the people.
\pop[2]Pushing any thoughts aside, that was \c[14]more\c[0] than enough to unite us all.
